name: Hilton Club New York

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I stayed here for 2 nights as a response to the offer of this stay, as Hilton Honors members, in conjunction with a presentation to buy into the Hilton Club. Essentially, the offer was for a room at ~half price ($350), with other perks.
reviews.title: Good stay, with a caveat
Not what it was
reviews.text: When we got to the hotel, we were directed to check in on the 37th floor. We were given a studio room 2 doors away from the lounge. It was a good size, about 250 sf. There was one king bed. The room was reasonably quiet, with not much noise from the street or lounge. There are suites on the floor.

The presentation was at the Hilton Club a few blocks away. We were told to expect to stay for 2 hours, but after expressing our lack of desire to buy a unit, we were finished after about 1 1/2 hrs. We received, as promised, 25K Hilton points and chits for $100 to use at a long list of restaurants, which we used that day for supper. In addition, we were offered a $100 chit for a future stay or 20K more points. We chose the latter. There was a desk with small sandwiches, cookies, and beverages before and after.
reviews.title: Nice modern decor and super location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I suspect that some people who are writing here are confusing the regular hotel with the 'Hilton Club' section. My understanding is that staying on floors other than 37 and 38 is staying in the regular 'New York Hilton Midtown Hotel'.
reviews.title: Nice Modern Accommodations

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: In any case, if we were to return to NYC, we would probably choose a more reasonably priced area, as lovely and convenient as it is to stay right in the the middle of NYC.
reviews.title: Hilton New York Stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We spent 3 nights at the Hilton Club in NYC earlier this week and just loved it. They have a super easy check-in on the 37th floor along with a great continental breakfast and evening appetizer buffet along with wine and beer. Soft drinks, coffee, tea and water are available 24 hours a day. The elevator bank was easy as it just went to 10 of the floors. We were able to walk to every destination except the 911 Memorial. The guest rooms were quite large, with a great flat screen TV, Bose radio, and well equipped bathroom. I would definitely stay again.
reviews.title: Great location, nice big rooms
Location location location
reviews.text: You cannot beat the location of this place. I have been to NYC a few times and always stayed in 2 star hotel a little way out as my thinking was that in NYC you only sleep in the room. Family man now with young children so a good location was essential. Rooms clean and tidy. We were checked in very fast and also check out was very fast. Only one fault was no tea and coffee making facility in the room. We only used the lobby bar on two occasions a pleasant place to sit and watch the world go by. If you want a good diner turn left out of the hotel and go to the Astro diner just one block up. We will stay here again.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: You probably can't ask for a better location if you are interested in visiting sights such as Rockefeller Center, Radio City Music Hall, MOMA and a myriad of fine restaurants. we stayed on the 38th floor as part of a Hilton Grand Vacations (on West 57th Street) package. Located on Sixth Avenue (Avenue of the Americas) with West 53rd Street on the South side and West 54th Street on the North side, you are close to everything. This hotel is a short walk to 7th Avenue and about 1/2 mile from Times Square. To the North you are about 6 blocks from Central Park. This is a great place to stay if you are interested in seeing midtown Manhattan on foot. The rooms are pricey but you wouldn't expect anything less for the value. Subway access is not far and for $2.50 you can travel just about anywhere in NYC. Safe Travels!
reviews.title: Location, Location, Location

reviews.text: We recently visited New York with our daughter and her husband and their two boys. We stayed on the 37th floor in a double suite. The rooms were of a very good size and well furnished and equipped: flat screen TVs and a Bose sound system. Very comfortable beds and a nice bathroom with a good quality shower. We enjoyed the benefits of the complementary breakfast each morning and the cocktail hour wine and beer with snacks each evening. The food and beverages were of a good quality and there was plenty of choice. The staff could not have been friendlier or more helpful. This was our first trip to New York although our daughter and son-in-law are frequent visitors. For folk like us who wanted to see as much as possible in just five days the situation of this hotel is excellent: a short walk to Central Park, Times Square and Grand Central Station. If you are intending to visit MOMA, it is just across the street. We were made to feel very welcome and would recommend this hotel without hesitation.
reviews.title: Great family holiday

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Had the misfortune to be in NY during hurricane Sandy. The hotel was brilliant! They had a help desk giving advice and information, and complementory coffee and muffins due to the limited availability elswhere. One manager even sent us a bottle of champagne and chocolates when he found out that our 4 day stay started on Sunday night, the begining of the hurricane and he new that our "experiences" were going to be limited.
reviews.title: Hurricane Sandy

reviews.text: We received a 1 Br Suite as part of a Hilton Grand Vacations Club Package, so we got good value but it's a special case, so I will focus just on the experience (rather than the price).
reviews.title: Very nice and confortable amenities

reviews.text: The room was nice and clean with a new feel to it. It had plenty of space in the bedroom, living room and bathroom. The extra sink in the living/eating area was a nice touch. We did have a mini-fridge in our room (other reviews said there was not one). There was no coffee maker or other kitchen appliances, but that was ok since the executive lounge had coffee, tea, water and soda available all day (in additional to continental BF each morning and reception with snacks each afternoon).
reviews.title: Hilton Club NYC 22/12/12 - 27/12/12
Not clean and pricy without any reason
reviews.text: The staff were all very helpful and overall service was great. All in all, it was a very good experience and I would like to return to this Hilton Club in the future.

Travelling with husband in a wheelchair and 3 boys (13,12 and 9) - we had 2 studios (one accessible) with connecting doors - worked very well for us. Accessible accommodation fantastic. Staff are all very polite/helpful etc. Nice breakfast in morning and snack and drinks early evening plus cookies in between (all included), plus the usual tea/coffee and soft drinks etc. Fantastic location. The only negative would be the slow lifts. Really fantastic stay but beware of the amount of rude tourists on the streets at this time of year!!!
reviews.title: Wonderful stay in Hilton Club studio
2BR Suite was incredible!!
reviews.text: We are 4 and had two executive suites. The rooms were beautiful but there is no mini-refrigerator. I don't know why they put em away. No chance to have a tea in your room with a boiler. You can have just a very poor breakfast at the executive lounge. You have to pay 36$ for bacon and many other typical foods in the other breakfast room. But the most horrible thing I didn't expect to find here was: EVERYTHING IS DIRTY. Teacups are dirty, spoons are dirty, tables where you should eat are dirty, too. Dishes and averything, as I told, is dirty. The service isn't bad but sometime is slow. Someone here is quite unkind or even rude.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed in newly renovated rooms in Feb 2013 on an RCI exchange. Friendly efficient check-in on the 37th floor was made even better with our room being ready when we arrived at noon. Very nice lounge including buffet breakfast, early evening wine and beer, plus fresh cookies later in the evening. The rooms are spacious by New York standards and the renovations are very nice. Excellent location near many of the key New York attractions. Well worth consideration of ownership.
reviews.title: Excellent experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I recently stayed at the Hilton Club at 53rd and 6th as part of a special package to get us to purchase a Hilton Grand Vacations Club timeshare. The location of the hotel cannot be beat...it is really convenient and close to Times Square, Rockefeller Plaza, Central Park, Columbus Circle and the train station at 47-50th streets, at 57th and 6th and at 53rd and 5th. The room was comfortable, with the king bed, plush pillows and enough space for a New York hotel room. The best part was the all day access to bottled water, sodas, coffee, tea, cookies etc. in the Hilton Club lounge on the 57th Floor. They also have beer and wine every night in there for guests from 5-7 pm and breakfast from 6-10 all included. We walked to our timeshare presentation at West 57th Street presented by Hilton Club and even though we didn't purchase one, it was certainly something that appealed to us. The service at the hotel was slightly lacking but overall adequate. The hotel lobby tends to be chaotic with large student groups and tour groups. Luggage hold is also a bit crazy but if you arrive early and need to leave your bags, the Hilton Club will pick it up for you and drop it off in your room after check in and you can avoid the $3.50 per bag fee. In general a really comfortable stay.
reviews.title: Comfortable and convenient

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Rooms are newly renovated. Clean, quiet and upscale. We stayed at the Hilton Club which is on the 37th and 38th floors of the hotel. I comes with lounge privileges which include a nice buffet continental breakfast and a Manager's reception in the lounge in the evening for cocktails and hors d'oervres.
reviews.title: Extremely enjoyable experience !!

reviews.text: When we last stayed in 2010 we enjoyed it so much that we bought a timeshare at this location - in the resale market it can be picked up for about $7,000 for about 10 days stay in a studio for each of the next 20 years or so (although the annual service charges aren't cheap!).
reviews.title: Another brilliant stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed for 2 weeks, and had a 2 bedroom, 2 bathroom, 1 reception unit which was great for my family including my father (3 adults and 2 children aged 4 and 1). The location is still (!) great - a few blocks from Central Park/Radio City/MoMA, and not very far from Times Square. Given we didn’t have a car seat we got the subway from JFK, which was actually a really easy journey, and not much slower than a cab. Apart from the E train there wasn’t a useful (to us!) subway line on the doorstep, but there are a few within a few blocks.
reviews.title: The last day ruined my initial review

description: The Hilton Club New York is superbly located on the 37th and 38th floors of the renowned Hilton New York offering the immediate convenience of a full-service hotel. Located in the heart of thriving midtown Manhattan, the surrounding ten-block neighborhood offers some of New York's most notable treasures. The Hilton Club New York offers an exclusive check-in on the 37th Floor just for Hilton Club hotel guests and features Studio, One and Two-bedroom Suites. The accommodations are elegantly appointed and offer numerous amenities to help capture the contemporary sophistication of Manhattan. As if the fantastic accommodations weren't enough to complement your stay in Manhattan, the Hilton Club New York offers a Club Lounge that has a daily complimentary Continental Breakfast (6:30am - 10am), complimentary soft drinks, coffee, tea, cookies and fruit (12pm - 7pm) and a Nightly Manager's Reception offering complimentary beverages and hot and cold hors d'oeuvres (5pm - 7pm). Lastly, guests of the Hilton Club have charge privileges at the restaurants, fitness center, spa and retail outlets of the Hilton New York.
